Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2007 06:20PM Areyousure wrote: When do you finally get staged or is Stage II/III an actual stage.  I don't think so.  I am still awaiting info on the reports for HER-2 and FISH or something like that.  Will that define the stage more clearly?
Posts.Title: Port Question AO44 Areyousure

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2007 06:46PM Areyousure wrote: Path reads:  IDC, Grade II/III, Tumor greatest diameter is 4.3 cm.  No necrosis, no calcif., surg margins free, etc.  Lymph node status:  Metastatic ductal carcinoma to 1 of 13 axillary lymph nodes.  ER+, PR +, HER-2/neu/FISH to follow.  I've left a bit out, but that's the most pertinent info, I think....  Anyway, the metastatic word scares me, but just a few lines above it clearly reads Grade II/III.  I'm confused.  I know this is a port site, so I'll move anytime, but if you could explain any of this to me, I'd appreciate it.
Posts.Title: Port Question AO44 Areyousure

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2007 08:31PM Areyousure wrote: Gosh, I don't know how to work this board-talking well, I've been checking for your response forever and now I see you answered me a long time ago.  MY BAD!  But I'm glad you think it's II.  I kept thinking that but then I started questioning myself...  I don't know if the nodes were sticking but the 'Gross Description' notes several tan-white rubbery nodules.  I'm not sure if that means the lymph nodes or not, but if it does, well, rubbery doesn't sound like they are sticking to each other.  I'm guessing??
